learning_objectives: Understand that plants make their own food
Know the ingredients needed for photosynthesis
Know where photosynthesis happens in plants
common_misconceptions: Plants get food from the soil
Plants only need water to grow
Photosynthesis and respiration are the same thing
guidelines.teaching_approach: Use the analogy of a kitchen/factory. Plants have a 'food factory' in their leaves. Connect to everyday observations like why plants need sunlight.

steps.content_hint: Introduce the idea that plants are special - they can make their own food! Unlike animals who have to find and eat food, plants have their own 'food factory' in their leaves.
The 'recipe' for photosynthesis: sunlight (energy), water (from roots), carbon dioxide (from air). These are the ingredients plants need to make food.
What does the plant factory produce? Glucose (food/sugar for energy) and oxygen (released into the air). This oxygen is what we breathe!
The factory workers: Chloroplasts are tiny parts inside leaf cells where photosynthesis happens. Chlorophyll is the green color that captures sunlight.
